pullRequest.body:
Also show that:

+ A finite projective module is also finitely presented (generalized from Free)

+ A direct summand of a reflexive module is reflexive. In particular, a finite projective module is reflexive.

---

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR

Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

maintainer merge
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by erdOne.

:v: erdOne can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11756841118/job/32753432575)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11756841118/job/32753432525)
bors d=erdOne
bors d=erdOne

```suggestion
instance (priority := 900) [Module.Finite R N] [Projective R N] : IsReflexive R N :=
```

The existing instance [Module.IsReflexive.of_finite_of_free](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/LinearAlgebra/Dual.html#Module.IsReflexive.of_finite_of_free) doesn't specify a priority. Should it?
There are currently only two instances of IsReflexive with mathematical content; the other is for Dual.
I think they should.
How do you decide which instances should have priorities lowered? Are `dual_finite`, `dual_projective` and `dual_free` any different from these two?
I think the rule of thumb is instances whose result type is `Class X Y Z` where `X Y Z` are free variables (without extra structures) should have lowered priority.
Okay, I get it.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(LinearAlgebra/Dual): generalize results from Free to Projective
